shinytdmore 1.0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Reference

All functions

POSIXToDate()

Format a POSIX datetime to a 'Date' object. Note that the returned string will depend on the application timezone.

POSIXToHours()

Convert POSIX date to hours (numeric).

POSIXToPrettyString()

Format a POSIX datetime to a well-formatted pretty string.

POSIXToString()

Format a POSIX datetime to a well-formatted string.

POSIXToTime()

Format a POSIX datetime to a time string. Note that the returned string will depend on the application timezone.

aboutTab()

About tab server.

aboutTabUI()

This tab shows general information out the application.

addNowLabelAndIntercept()

Add now label ('Past' and 'Future') and X intercept to an existing plot.

reactiveFit() reactiveRecommendation() calculationReactives() reactivePredict()

Reactives that can be used to support tdmore calculations

checkCovariates()

Check covariates.

checkFirstname()

Check firstname.

checkLastname()

Check lastname.

checkModelName()

Check model name.

covariatesTable()

Create a user interface to represent the covariates

defaultApp()

Default full-featured application

doseTable()

Server component for doseTable

editableCombodate()

Create an in-place editable combodate. This function adds some default options for the format.

editableHtml5()

Create an in-place editable html5 element. This creates an X-editable of type `text`, with the appropriate template for the input element.

editableInput()

Create an in-place editable input control

fitPlot()

Fitplot creates a Population, Fit and Recommendation plot

fitPlotUI()

This UI element displays several plots that show the current state of the fit.

getAppTimeZone()

Get the application timezone.

getCovariateNames()

Get all covariate names of a model. By default, covariate names from the model are returned. For MPC models, only the 'true' covariates are returned (e.g. WT, not TVCl).

getDBDatetimeFormat()

Get the DB datetime format for this project.

getDateFormat()

Get the date format for this project.

getDatetimeFormat()

Get the datetime format for this project.

getDefaultModel()

Get default model. If the given model is not a mixture model, this model is returned. If the given model is a mixture_model, the most likely model is returned.

getMeasureColumnLabel()

Get measure column label.

getModelOutput()

Get model output variable name.

getNewdata()

Create a newdata data.frame compatible with [tdmore::predict.tdmorefit()]

getTableBorder()

Utility function to know where the horizontal line corresponding to the now date should be

getTimeFormat()

Get the time format for this project.

getWinnerFit()

Get winner fit. If the given fit is not a tdmorefit mixture, this fit is returned. If the given fit is a tdmorefit mixture, the winner fit is returned.

getYAxisLabel()

Get a nice Y-axis label.

hot_to_r_datetime()

Conversion function to convert an rhandsontable created with timeTable back to a data.frame with a single `time` column.

ipredColor()

individual prediction color (red).

mergePlots()

Merge plots.

modelTab()

Model tab server.

modelTabUI()

Model tab user interface.

nowColor()

Now color (green).

nowColorHex()

Now color (green) - HEX.

nowInputUI() nowInput()

Input element representing the current time

observationTable()

Create a user interface to represent the observations

pad()

Pad integer with a zero if needed.

predColor()

Population prediction color (blue).

predictionTab()

Prediction tab server.

predictionTabUI()

Prediction tab user interface.

prepareParametersPlot()

Prepare the parameters plot.

preparePredictionPlot()

Prepare the prediction plot.

preparePredictionPlots()

Prepare population OR individual prediction plots. This includes the prediction plot and the timeline plot.

prepareRecommendationPlots()

Prepare recommendation plots (to be refactored). This includes the recommendation plot and the timeline plot.

prepareTimelinePlot()

Prepare the timeline.

recommendationColor()

Recommendation color (green).

recommendationTable()

The recommendationTable uses the state$regimen and state$recommendation tables

reportsTab()

Reports tab server.

reportsTabUI()

Reports tab user interface.

samplesColor()

Samples color (grey).

samplesColorFuture()

Samples color in the future (red).

shinyInput()

Allow to provide HTML/javascript code in shiny app for custom inputs. Example if FUN is actionButton: <button id=\"removeButton_1\" type=\"button\" class=\"btn btn-default action-button\" onclick=\"Shiny.onInputChange(&quot;removePatientButton&quot;, this.id)\">Remove</button>".

shinytdmore-data

Data format description

shinytdmore-module

Basic definition for module server components

shinytdmore-plot

Default values for plot parameters

singleReactive()

Create a function that behaves as a reactiveVal(), but is backed by a reactiveValues() object

stringToPOSIX()

Convert a string date to a POSIX datetime.

synchronizedHotUi() synchronizedHot()

An rhandsontable that is synchronized to a reactiveValues element

tableUI()

Create a user interface to represent a table, with a "table" UI element and an "Add" button

targetColor()

Target color (grey).

targetInputUI() targetInput()

Input element representing the target upper limit and lower limits The input element is synchronized to state$target$min and state$target$max If state$target does not exist, it creates this as list(min=NA, max=NA). NA assumes the model-defined min/max criteria will be used.

timeTable()

Create an rhandsontable based on the given data-frame

updateEditableInput()

Change the value of an in-place editable input on the client

updatePlot()

Update an existing plot with new data using animation.

Contents

  • All functions
